result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie Davis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Willie Davis in court, in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Willie Davis.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for return on doctors report.  Parties review and do not contest the findings of Dr. Ana Garcia dated 9/22/2022.  Court finds the defendant is incompetent to proceed at this time but is likely to become competent.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame.  Case adjourned to Br. 9 for Review hearing on doctor's report. Review hearing scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 11:00 am.
for Court Order of Medication and/or Treatment, received and filed
Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.
Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.

Pursuant to letter received from DHS, the competency evaluation will not be completed prior to next scheduled hearing date of 9/15/2022.  With Court approval, and approval from the parties, the hearing on Doctor's Report Return is rescheduled to 10/7/2022 at 10:30 am.
for Extension requested by Dr. DeBoer, filed.

Defendant Willie Davis in court, in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Willie Davis.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for Annie Louk for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case currently assigned to Br. 13 and called along with Case 21CF4515 for Doctor's Report Return. Doctor Collins report received and filed.  Court orders defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to be transported FORTHWITH to a DHS facility for an inpatient competency re-evaluation. Case adjourned to Br. 9.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:30 am. Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Willie Davis in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Willie Davis in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for bail/bond hearing.  
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  
Order for Examination, signed and filed. 
Court allows this case to be heard with Branch 17's case, 2021CF4515, for a Return on Doctor's Report that is scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 9:30 am. Case is to be put back on Branch 37's calendar after the result of the doctor's report is determined. 
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Willie Davis not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means. Defendant has multiple cases in the criminal system. Court ordered case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 37.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willie Davis not in court, defendant in custody.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Matter set for pretrial conference.  The SPD office has not been able to appoint counsel and requests another date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 37.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Latasha D.T.; Adam E.F.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Willie Davis in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Willie Davis in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Willie Davis appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
